document.masterDocTitle: On the taxonomy and zoogeography of some Oxypoda species of the West Palaearctic region (Coleoptera: Staphylinidae: Aleocharinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: On the taxonomy and zoogeography of some Oxypoda species of the West Palaearctic region (Coleoptera: Staphylinidae: Aleocharinae)

paragraph.heading:
Oxypoda ( Thliboptera ) platyptera FAIRMAIRE 1859
( Fig. 1 , Map 1 )

subSubSection.paragraph:
Oxypoda planipennis FAIRMAIRE & LABOULBENE 1856
: 435
; primary homonym.

Type material examined
Syntypes : 2 [mounted on the same pin]: "Haut-Pyrenaees, Südfrankreich / platyptera Fairm. Type , ded. Fairmaire / Chicago NHMus M.Bernhauer Collection / Syntypes Oxypoda platyptera Fairmaire , rev. V. Assing 2009 " (FMNH)
.

paragraph.materialsCitation: France : 3 exs. , Hautes-Pyrénées, Aulon env., 29.VI.2010 , leg. Terlutter (cTer, cFel).

caption.paragraph:
Map 1 : Distribution of
Oxypoda platyptera FAIRMAIRE
based on revised records.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Comment: FAIRMAIRE & LABOULBÉNE (1856) described
Oxypoda planipennis
from an unspecified number of syntypes collected in "H.-Pyr., vallée de Campan". The name is a primary homonym and was subsequently replaced with the nomen novum
O. platyptera
by FAIRMAIRE (1859) . Two male syntypes were located in the Bernhauer collection at the FMNH.
Oxypoda platyptera
was moved to the subgenus
Thliboptera
by ASSING (2009) .

In the Palaearctic catalogue ( SMETANA 2004 ),
O. platyptera
is listed only for Italy , although it was described from France . GAMARRA & OUTERELO (2005) report the species from four Spanish provinces. As can be inferred from the material examined,
O. platyptera
is widespread and fairly common in the Iberian peninsula. The specimens from Portugal represent new country records. The distribution is mapped in Map 1 .
For an illustration of the aedeagus see Fig. 1 .
